"I can do Shakespeare, Ibsen, English accents, Irish accents, no accent, stand on my head, tap dance, sing, look 17 or look 70," Ladd told The New York Times for a profile published on Sept. 23, 1976.
Ladd's later film credits included "National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation," "Ghosts of Mississippi," "Primary Colors" and the 2015 drama "Joy," a biopic of Miracle Mop inventor Joy Mangano.

Ladd drew raves for her performance as Dern's character's mother on Mike White's cult HBO dramedy "Enlightened." Dern played a troubled sales executive who moves back in with her mom after a nervous breakdown at the office.
"It's good to see you, Mom," Dern's Amy Jellicoe says earnestly in one episode. Ladd's reply: "Why?"
Ladd was married three times. She was married to Oscar-nominated actor Bruce Dern from 1960 to 1969; William Shea Jr. from 1969 to 1977; and Robert Hunter from 1999 until his death earlier this year.

title: A Fox News report prompted Trump to post about Nigeria, setting off White House scramble
summary: A Fox News report prompted President Trump to call out Nigeria over the killing of Christians and then threaten military action, multiple U.S. officials said.
story: WASHINGTON — A Fox News report prompted President Donald Trump to call out Nigeria over the killing of Christians and then threaten military action, setting off a scramble in the White House over the weekend, according to multiple U.S. officials.

It’s still unclear what — if anything — the administration will do to counter Islamic militants in Nigeria, but precision drone strikes are among the preliminary options being considered, two U.S. officials said.
A White House spokesperson declined Monday to offer any details on the plans under consideration.

“At President Trump’s direction, the administration is planning options for possible action to stop the killing of Christians in Nigeria," the spokeswoman, Anna Kelly, said in a statement. "Any announcements will come from the President directly."

Trump's first social media post on Nigeria came Friday night after he watched a Fox News report on violence in the West African nation, two administration officials said. The president asked his staff for more information about the situation and, shortly after, declared in a Truth Social post that he was designating Nigeria a "country of particular concern" over its failure to, in his words, stop the "mass slaughter" of Christians.
Trump then went further in a Saturday post, directing the Defense Department to prepare for possible military action.

“If the Nigerian Government continues to allow the killing of Christians, the U.S.A. will immediately stop all aid and assistance to Nigeria, and may very well go into that now disgraced country, ‘guns-a-blazing,’ to completely wipe out the Islamic Terrorists who are committing these horrible atrocities,” Trump wrote.

It’s not the first time the president’s rapid fire social media posts have moved faster than policy deliberations, with officials rushing to draft diplomatic and military options and allied governments taken by surprise.

Experts and scholars who follow events in Nigeria say Trump’s portrayal of the security situation in the country as a “Christian genocide” is misleading and oversimplified, as Nigerians of all faiths have suffered at the hands of Islamist extremists and other groups.
Trump's posts even contradicted one of his own senior State Department advisors, Massad Boulous, who said last month that Muslims have died in larger numbers than Christians.

“People of all religions and of all tribes are dying, and it is very unfortunate, and we even know that Boko Haram and ISIS are killing more Muslims than more Christians," Boulos said while meeting with the Nigerian President Bola Ahmed Tinubu in Rome, according to state media outlet, Voice of Nigeria. "So people are suffering from all sorts of backgrounds. This is not specifically targeted at one group or the other."

Speaking to reporters on Monday, Trump hinted that he was open to sending troops on the ground in Nigeria, but that seemed like a far less likely option as he has generally been loath to deploy troops to conflicts overseas, according to the two U.S. officials.
A senior Trump administration official said the White House is in regular contact with the Nigerian government.

“We hope that the Nigerian government will be a partner in the process of addressing this issue, and work with the United States to take swift and immediate action to address the violence that is affecting Christians, as well as countless other innocent civilians across Nigeria,” the official said.

Nigeria’s government was taken aback by Trump’s statements, but officials cited the two countries’ friendly relations and called for a cooperative approach between the two governments to tackle the threat posed by Islamist groups.

Daniel Bwala, an advisor to Nigeria’s president, told the BBC that any military action against the Islamist groups should be carried out jointly. Nigeria would welcome U.S. help in tackling the militants but added that it was a “sovereign” country.

Insurgent groups like Boko Haram and Islamic State’s branch in West Africa sometimes use anti-Christian language, but their attacks are indiscriminate, targeting civilians, officials, and local leaders regardless of religion, according to Miriam Adah, an analyst with the Armed Conflict Location and Event Data project (ACLED), a U.S.-based nonprofit that tracks conflicts and crises.

“In Nigeria, the violence is widespread and complex. It involves insurgents, bandits, ethnic clashes, and land disputes — not a single campaign to eliminate Christians,” Adah said. “Both Christians and Muslims are victims.”

The bipartisan U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom has pointed to violence against both Christians and Muslims in Nigeria, saying there are systematic religious freedom violations in the country. “Violence affects large numbers of Christians and Muslims in several states across Nigeria,” the commission said in a report last year.
It also described the Nigerian government response to attacks on Nigerian civilians by “nonstate actors” as slow or ineffective.
Islamist groups like Boko Haram are not the only actors behind violence in Nigeria, experts say.

Apart from Boko Haram and an Islamic State branch in northern Nigeria, there is a separatist movement in the southeast, ethnic militant groups in the oil-producing Niger Delta, kidnapping gangs in the northwest and clashes between Muslim herders and Christian farmers in the Middle Belt fueled by climate change.
Trump’s comments may have had more to do with domestic American politics than addressing a security threat in Nigeria, experts said.

Some Republican lawmakers, aligned with elements of Nigeria’s Christian diaspora population in the United States, have long focused on the plight of Christians in Nigeria. And Trump may have been trying to deliver a message to his Christian supporters in the United States, experts said.

“Republicans on the Hill in particular, for years, have been trying to frame Nigeria as ‘a Christian genocide,’ and they have strong allies in the Nigerian diaspora in the United States,” said Darren Kerr, dean of the School of Peace Studies at the University of California at San Diego.

Nigeria’s population of 230 million is split almost evenly between Muslims and Christians, and the sectarian divide has triggered political violence in the past. Trump’s comments threaten to potentially “light a match” in an already fragile landscape, Kerr said.

“To bring the weight of the United States solely on the Christian side and to frame things in a Muslim-Christian dimension is probably extremely unhelpful to both Christians and Muslims in Nigeria,” Kerr said.
The United States does, however, have grounds to question how the Nigerian government is using the weapons and other assistance that Washington has delivered over the years, Kerr said.

“Had the President been more measured in his comments to say ‘Nigeria, we give it all this money, what’s happened? That, I think, is a legitimate criticism on the part of the United States to say to the government, ‘Look, what are you guys doing? Where’s the strategy? Where’s the success, where’s the progress that we’re expecting?’”

title: Jonathan Bailey Named 2025 People's Sexiest Man Alive
summary: Find out who has been named People's Sexiest Man Alive for 2025.
story: The 2025 People’s Sexiest Man Alive is one wickedly good-looking guy.
During the Nov. 3 episode of “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon,” Jonathan Bailey was announced as the magazine’s sexiest man alive for this year.
The “Wicked” franchise star made an appearance during the late-night talk show, where both his covers were revealed.
“It’s an honor of a lifetime,” Bailey told host Jimmy Fallon, signing his copy of the magazine.
“Couldn’t happen to a nicer guy,” Fallon said, to which Bailey rejoiced by saying, “Every time I come here, it’s always something.”
Bailey, who joins a long list of People’s Sexiest Man Alive alum, said he found out about earlier this year when he was doing a production of Shakespeare’s “Richard III” overseas.
“In 2025, I’m sort of thrilled that People magazine have invited someone in, to bestow this honor on someone who can really cherish the value of a sexy man,” he said.
Bailey also spoke about having his adorable dog Benson on one of the covers with him, saying, “He’s such a good boy.”
Bailey has captured hearts as Lord Anthony Bridgerton in Netflix’ period drama “Bridgerton.” He’s also starred in “Jurassic World: Rebirth,” as well as “Fellow Travelers.”
Most recently, he’s embodied the dashing and swoon-worthy Fiyero in “Wicked” and the upcoming sequel “Wicked: For Good,” out Nov. 21.
During his interview, he also joked that he “f------ hopes” people treat him differently now that he’s this year’s sexiest man.
Bailey takes over the title from John Krasinski, who was crowned the magazine's Sexiest Man Alive in 2024.
The “Office” star-turned-action hero told People he thought perhaps he was being “punked” when he heard about the honor.
“That’s not how I wake up, thinking, ‘Is this the day that I’ll be asked to be Sexiest Man Alive?’ And yet it was the day you guys did it. You guys have really raised the bar for me,” he said.
Krasinski added that when his movie star wife, Emily Blunt, learned he had been named Sexiest Man Alive, she suggested they cover their home in wallpaper of his People cover.
People has been choosing its Sexiest Man Alive since 1985 when Mel Gibson became the first in a long line of famous celebs from all walks of life to win the honor.

Bailey and Krasinski follow in the footsteps of several other Hollywood actors who have been named the sexiest man in recent years, including former “Grey’s Anatomy” star Patrick Dempsey, who won the title in 2023, Marvel Cinematic Universe star Chris Evans, who won in 2022, and Paul Rudd, who was crowned in 2021.

Ahead of Bailey’s big reveal, a slew of past winners took part in a video where they “passed the phone” off to other cover stars. Dempsey kicked off the clip followed by Blake Shelton, John Legend, Harry Hamlin, Idris Elba and many others.

title: 'Dancing With the Stars' Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night: See the Full List of Songs
summary: Week 8 of “Dancing with the Stars” tips its hat to the genre of rock ’n’ roll on its Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night. See every song the couples will dance to.
story: “Dancing with the Stars” tips its hat to the genre of rock ’n’ roll on its Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night in Week 8 of the competition.
For the Nov. 4 “DWTS” episode, the remaining eight couples salute a few rock legends as they dance to hits by The Beach Boys, Bon Jovi, Elton John, the late Ozzy Osbourne and more.

The night begins with an opening number set to “Pour Some Sugar On Me” by Def Leppard and “Fight The Power” by Public Enemy choreographed by Britt Stewart. It will also feature a tour number to “Hey Ya!” by Outkast, choreographed by Mandy Moore, and a troupe dance to “Higher Ground” by Stevie Wonder.
Former Public Enemy rapper Flavor Flav, himself a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee, will appear as a guest judge during Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night.

In a fun twist, the show's co-hosts Alfonso Ribeiro and Julianne Hough will each join one of the two teams who will dance during special live performances by Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductees Chicago and Kool & the Gang.
Then, the eight competing couples will hit the dance floor with their routines.
Last week’s “Halloween Night” episode saw the elimination of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Jen Affleck and Jan Ravnik.

The episode also revealed that “Parent Trap” star Elaine Hendrix had to be hospitalized after sustaining a rib injury during rehearsals. She and pro partner Alan Bersten advanced in the competition after being judged on their taped rehearsal routine.
Read on to learn which rock songs each couple will dance to on the Tuesday, Nov. 4 episode of “Dancing With the Stars,” airing at 8 p.m. on ABC.
Alix Earle and Val Chmerkovskiy
Social media personality Earle and Chmerkovskiy will dance a paso doble to “Livin’ On a Prayer” by Bon Jovi.
Robert Irwin and Witney Carson
Wildlife conservationist Irwin and his partner Carson will perform a paso doble to “Icky Thump” by The White Stripes.
Whitney Leavitt and Mark Ballas
Leavitt, a cast member of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives,”  and pro partner Ballas will perform a paso doble to “No More Tears” by Ozzy Osbourne.
Dylan Efron and Daniella Karagach
Reality TV star Efron and his partner Karagach will perform a jive routine to “I’m Still Standing” by Elton John.
Andy Richter and Emma Slater
Comedian Richter and his partner Slater will perform a contemporary routine to “God Only Knows” by The Beach Boys.
Elaine Hendrix and Alan Bersten
Film and TV star Hendrix and Bersten will perform a Viennese waltz to “What the World Needs Now Is Love” by Dionne Warwick.
Danielle Fishel and Pasha Pashkov
Former “Boy Meets World” star Fishel and partner Pashkov will perform a contemporary routine to “Dream On” by Aerosmith.
Jordan Chiles and Ezra Sosa
Olympic gold medalist Chiles and partner Sosa will perform a jazz routine to “River Deep — Mountain High” by Ike & Tina Turner.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actor and Laura Dern's Mom, Dies at 89
summary: Diane Ladd, known for her Oscar-nominated performances in movies like “Alice Doesn’t Live Here” and mother of actor Laura Dern, has died at the age of 89.
story: Diane Ladd, known for her Oscar-nominated performances in movies like “Alice Doesn’t Live Here” and mother of actor Laura Dern, has died at the age of 89.
Dern confirmed her mother’s passing in a statement obtained by NBC News on Monday, Nov. 3.
“My amazing hero and my profound gift of a mother, Diane Ladd, passed with me beside her this morning, at her home in Ojai, (California),” Dern said.
She called her mother, “The greatest daughter, mother, grandmother, actress, artist and empathetic spirit that only dreams could have seemingly created.”
Dern added, “We were blessed to have her. She is flying with her angels now.”

Ladd appeared in hundreds of roles but was best known for her work as Flo in the 1974 film “Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore” and Marietta Fortune in the 1990 movie “Wild at Heart.” Both parts landed her Academy Award nominations for best actress in a supporting role.

The late star received another Oscar nod for her portrayal in “Rambling Rose,” the 1991 coming-of-age period drama that also starred daughter Dern in the leading role. Both mother and daughter received nominations at the 1992 Academy Awards, with Ladd competing in the supporting category and Dern being recognized in the leading role category.
Ladd was also praised for her television roles. She received Emmy nominations for her guest appearances on “Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman,” “Grace Under Fire” and “Touched by an Angel.”

Her career in Hollywood spanned eight decades. One of her many recurring roles was on the sitcom “Alice,” in which she appeared in 23 episodes according to IMDb. She also booked parts in popular movies and shows like “National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation,” “The Love Boat,” “ER” and “Cold Case.”

More recently, she co-starred with Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper in the 2015 drama “Joy” and appeared in 46 episodes of the Hallmark Channel series “Chesapeake Shores” from 2016 to 2022. Her final role was in the 2022 drama “Isle of Hope,” according to IMDb.

Ladd was married to Bruce Dern from 1960 to 1969. She then married William A. Shea, Jr. and the two later divorced in 1976. Her third husband was former CEO of PepsiCo Food Systems Robert Charles Hunter, who died at the age of 77 in August, The Hollywood Reporter reported.

title: Craig Melvin Recalls the Adorable Way He Met Wife Lindsay at Work
summary: Craig Melvin recalled meeting wife Lindsay on air and how they started dating.
story: A producer counting down in Craig Melvin's ear during a return from a commercial break at NBC's Washington affiliate in 2008 was unwittingly counting the seconds until Craig met his future wife.
The TODAY co-anchor recounted on Jenna & Friends on Nov. 3 how he met his wife of 14 years, Lindsay Czarniak, when the two appeared live on the air together on WRC-TV in the nation's capital.
"Back then there was no hard-launching," Craig said. "This is 2008, and I did it the old-fashioned way — I stalked her at work."
"This was when you could do that. You could meet at work. You could date at work. I knew who she was before I got there."

Lindsay had been in Beijing covering the Olympics for the network when Craig was first hired by NBC's Washington affiliate. One day Craig was on air talking to a producer between commercials with his back turned when his future wife surprised him. She had returned from China to get back to her normal schedule.

"And I turned, and the guy filling in for her wasn't there. I didn't know that, and I turned and I'm like, 'Oh, hey, uh,' and so I got a little tongue-tied," Craig remembered. "I was like, 'Hey, welcome back from the Olympics,' and she's like, 'Welcome to Channel 4, loser. She didn't say 'loser,'" he joked.
That serendipitous moment played a role in their 2011 wedding.
"So she pulled the video for our rehearsal dinner," Craig said. "So we met on the air. I guess technically we did. We met on NBC."
Craig and Lindsay also spoke with Sheinelle Jones on TODAY in 2021 about their first meeting.
"I had just gotten back from Beijing, and he was hired," Lindsay said. "I didn't know him, but I slid in, and we met during a commercial break. And I was like, 'Who is this guy?'"
Three years later, Craig proposed to Lindsay on a boat in Miami.
The couple celebrated their 14th wedding anniversary in October and are parents of two children: Delano, 11, and Sybil, 8.

title: Mandy Moore Teases New NFL Drama from 'This Is Us' Creator Dan Fogelman
summary: Mandy Moore is reunited with Dan Fogelman of "This Is Us" for an NFL drama on Hulu.
story: It's been three years since "This Is Us" ended, but the show’s creator is hoping to strike TV magic once again with his new Hulu series.
Dan Fogelman is teaming up with Mandy Moore, who played Rebecca in "This Is Us," for an untitled football drama that also stars Christopher Meloni.
On Nov. 3, Moore shared new details about the series while appearing on “TODAY with Jenna & Friends.”
“Dan’s new show, we just started shooting it two weeks ago. It’s centered around the NFL," she said.
Moore says the show focuses on "the daughter of the owner of an NFL team," who she plays.

Moore, who runs the "That Was Us" rewatch podcast with her co-stars Sterling K. Brown and Chris Sullivan, said that she misses "This Is Us." But she's happy to be Fogelman once again and is gathering lots of knowledge about football.
“I feel like Taylor Swift. I’ve had to learn all about the NFL. I knew nothing about the NFL,” she teased.

Given the show's subject matter, Jenna Bush Hager was curious to know if Moore had talked to Charlotte Jones, who grew up as the daughter of Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones. Charlotte Jones is now a co-owner of the team.
“I did talk to Charlotte Jones,” the actor said.
“I’m a Texan, so I love her. She’s a powerhouse. Is that your role?” Jenna asked.
"Yeah. Someone who’s being primed to take over her dad when he steps down," Moore said. "It’s going to be on Hulu next year."
The 41-year-old, whose character is named Lauren Durkin, recently shared a photo from the set of the untitled series with her co-star, Meloni.
"First day of production for our new drama series created by the incredible @danfogman! See you soon on @hulu and don’t forget… football is family. 🏈🧡," she captioned the post.
William H. Macy will also star in the series as Moore's father, Hank Durkin, per Deadline. Meloni will play the team's head coach, Danny Roarke. Chace Crawford also stars as a general manager.
Moore also posted a photo of her and Meloni's chairs on set of the football drama on the first day of filming.
Fogelman is clearly psyched to work with Moore once again and sang her praises in a recent Instagram post.
"Rapunzel, then Rebecca, now Lauren. Mandy is about to crush. Again," he captioned a photo of an article announcing that the actor had joined the cast of the show.
Fogelman reunited with "This Is Us" star Sterling K. Brown for the Hulu show "Paradise," which was renewed for Season 2.

title: Rob Kardashian Just Returned to 'The Kardashians.' What Has He Been Up To?
summary: What has Rob Kardashian been up to? Where is he now? About his relationships, kids, work and return to reality TV.
story: After a long hiatus from reality TV, Rob Kardashian made a rare appearance on Season 7 of "The Kardashians."

Rob Kardashian, who is Kris Jenner's only son, reunited with his family members in Episode 2 when they all got together to say goodbye to their family home, which was featured prominently in the E! show "Keeping Up with the Kardashians."
Rob Kardashian, 38, is the youngest of the four children Kris Jenner shared with her late ex-husband, also named Robert Kardashian.
In a confessional, Kourtney Kardashian Barker revealed what it felt like to have her big brother around.
"It's nice that we can all be here together and that my brother is here," she said.
The Poosh founder then opened up about the different types of relationships that Rob Kardashian has with their siblings.

"Him and Khloé are a little incestual," she joked. "Him and Kim are like the husband and wife that hate each other. And then Rob and I, we were super close friends at one point where we would always go out together. We would always hold hands and have so much fun together. I love having him around."

Rob Kardashian has made very few appearances on "The Kardashians" in recent years. In 2016, he made his last big TV appearance on his one-season reality TV show with ex Blac Chyna called "Rob & Chyna."
Scroll below to see what Rob Kardashian is up to now.
What has Rob Kardashian been up to?
Rob Kardashian hasn't posted a picture on his official Instagram account since 2024.
However, in April 2025, Kim Kardashian shared a sweet snap of her with her brother and a few of their other family members online.

In the caption, she wished everyone a happy Easter. Then in June, Rob Kardashian made another appearance on his sister's IG account when Kim Kardashian shared a snap of them celebrating La La Anthony's birthday together.
Rob Kardashian has embarked on multiple business ventures. He launched the hot sauce brand Grandeza in 2020. However, the website is no longer active.
He also started a sock line, Arthur George, in 2012. The website is still up and running.
Is Rob Kardashian in a relationship?
Rob Kardashian opened up about his dating life during a July 2025 appearance on sister Khloé Kardashian's “Khloé in Wonder Land” podcast.
He said that he's "talking" to people.

“I’m good at talking to people. But also there (are) moments where I’m like, 'OK, I can’t talk to anybody, it’s too much energy. It’s just too much. I’m talking to too many people.' I don’t want to be like that,” he said.
Rob Kardashian’s last public relationship was with his daughter’s mother, Blac Chyna.
The couple’s relationship was documented in the E! show “Rob & Chyna.” The pair ended up breaking up in 2017 and have since been focused on raising their daughter, Dream, together.

“I’ve been single since — she’s 8 years old, I’ve been single for eight years. Of course I’ve dated and stuff, but I’ve never gotten serious or wanted to, my energy is just into Dream. I’m probably too strict with that, like I probably should have fun and enjoy my life, and I still have fun, I just don’t care to be dating somebody,” he said on the podcast.
Would Rob Kardashian return to reality TV?
On Khloé Kardashian's "Khloé in Wonder Land” podcast, he said he would be interested in returning to reality TV if the circumstance was right.
“I love filming if it’s positive and natural and I’m feeling good about myself, then of course if I’m comfortable,” he said. “I like being around my family so that stuff is good to me.”
As for why he hasn't appeared on any prior seasons of Hulu's “The Kardashians"? Rob Kardashian said it has to do with him.

“It just has everything to do with myself. I don’t want to be filming and putting myself in a position where I’m not comfortable,” he said. “I’m not comfortable in my skin so why would I want to go and be on camera and just be vulnerable and let people in when that’s not what I want to do?”

“I haven’t been comfortable with myself in years and also filming and just doing all that, it’s not for everybody. And I choose my own happiness and peace rather than filming for somebody who doesn’t do anything for me and my personal life. That’s the truth,” he added.

title: See a Full List of the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade Performers
summary: The list of performers for the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade has come out, featuring stars of "KPop Demon Hunters," Colbie Caillat and more.
story: The 99th Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade is shaping up to be one for the ages.
The roster of stars who will perform during this year’s edition of the iconic event features some names who will help make the holiday a memorable one.

More than 5,000 volunteers help get the parade off the ground, while this year’s edition will feature the debut of four new balloons, including — Buzz Lightyear from “Toy Story,” the Onion Carriage from “Shrek,” PAC-MAN and Marion from Nintendo fame. Derpy Tiger and Sussie from Netflix’s “KPop Demon Hunters” will appear as a midsized balloon and balloonicle, respectively.

“Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade is the official kickoff to the holiday season and has been part of the nation’s stories and traditions for generations,” Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade executive producer Will Coss said in a statement.

“The most wonderful stories start at the Parade. On Thanksgiving morning, larger-than-life character balloons, awe-inspiring floats and showstopping performances will create unforgettable moments and lasting holiday memories for millions of spectators in New York City and across the country.”
Who’s performing at the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?

This year’s parade will include the daytime debut of EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI, the singing voices of HUNTR/X from “KPop Demon Hunters.” There will also be performances from Broadway’s “Buena Vista Social Club,” “Just in Time” and “Ragtime.”

Other acts who will perform include Drew Baldridge, Matteo Bocelli, Colbie Caillat, Ciara, Gavin DeGraw, Meg Donnelly, Mr. Fantasy, Foreigner, Debbie Gibson, Mickey Guyton, Christopher Jackson, Jewel, Lil Jon, Kool & the Gang, Darlene Love, Roman Mejia, Taylor Momsen, Tiler Peck, Radio City Rockettes, Busta Rhymes, Calum Scott, Shaggy, Lauren Spencer Smith, Luísa Sonza and Teyana Taylor.

In addition, there will be appearances by actors Nikki DeLoach and Kristoffer Polaha, American figure skater Ilia Malinin and U.S Paralympian Jack Wallace, with “Hot Ones” host Sean Evans serving as special correspondent.
When is the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
The parade will take place Thanksgiving Day, Nov. 27 at 8:30 a.m. in all time zones.
How can I watch the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
The parade will air on NBC and can also be streamed on Peacock.
Who is hosting the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
TODAY’s Savannah Guthrie and Al Roker will host, alongside former TODAY co-anchor Hoda Kotb.

title: The November 2025 Read With Jenna Pick Is the Story of a Family Curse
summary: What is the Read With Jenna November 2025 book pick? Here's the title.
story: Jenna Bush Hager says she's been a fan of Oyinkan Braithwaite since reading her debut novel, "My Sister the Serial Killer."
"Her mix of both humor and wisdom with such a fresh new perspective," she tells TODAY.com.
Which is what made her especially excited to read — and ultimately pick — Braithwaite's followup "Cursed Daughters" for her Read With Jenna book club.
"I was delighted by this book," she says.
"Cursed Daughters" follows "family of women in Lagos who believe they are not destined to love" due to a generational curse, Jenna says.
"This is a book about family, sisterhood and what it means to fall in love," Jenna says, teasing "a few epic love stories at the center."
"Cursed Daughters" by Oyinkan Braithwaite

"It is very funny at moments and extremely poignant at others. It'll have you getting a pen out to underline as I did. I think you will love this book and I hope you will share it with your daughters, your sisters, your mothers," she continues.
Speaking to TODAY, Braithwaite says she wanted to write something completely different from her bestselling debut "My Sister the Serial Killer" for her second novel.

"I had a need to challenge myself to see what I can do. I definitely didn't want to be like, 'What does "My Sister the Serial Killer" part 2 look like?'" she says. "I don't think I would have been fulfilled."

Braithwaite says her books always start with a concept that intrigues her. In the case of "Cursed Daughters," what she was drawn to was the idea of reincarnation. One character in the book is believed to be the reincarnation of her aunt, who died just as she was being born.
While Braithwaite was figuring out the family's backstory, she landed on the idea of a generational curse that says no woman will be able to "hold onto a man."
"This novel is basically about all the women who have to contend with this curse and this legacy, and the three youngest women of this family and how they deal with it," she continues.

Ebun and Monife are first cousins who go about dealing with the curse differently: Ebun runs from romance and Monife goes headfirst into it. Ebun's first-born, Eniiyi, lives in the shadow of all that went wrong for her aunt Monife.
The book also goes back many generations in the family to see how the curse presented itself — "if it was a curse" at all, Braithwaite says.
She says readers have to look forward to a bit of romance, in addition to all the deep family ties.
"I hope people ship some of the couples. Fingers crossed," she says.

title: Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo Reveal Matching Tattoos Ahead of 'Wicked: For Good' Release
summary: In a social media post shared on Grande's Instagram account, the "Wicked" actress debuted the pair's matching 'For Good' tattoos on the palm of their hands.
story: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo just commemorated their roles in "Wicked" and their lasting bond in a special way.
With just weeks left before "Wicked: For Good" premieres, the co-stars gave their followers a first look at the matching tattoos they got to celebrate the sequel.
The post, which was shared on both Grande and Erivo's Instagram pages, included two photos: one of the actors on set, and one of their sweet tattoos.

In the picture, the stars overlapped their hands, with Erivo's on top of Grande's. Both tattoos say "For Good," with Erivo opting to get hers on her left hand on the palm by her thumb. Meanwhile, Grande chose to have hers in the very center of her palm on her right hand.
The duo captioned their post with a message that read: "happy wicked month @wickedmovie ♡ 20 days."

"Wicked: For Good" is the sequel to the first "Wicked" film, and is set to be released on Nov. 21, 2025. In the films, Erivo plays Elphaba, who becomes the Wicked Witch of the West, and Grande plays Glinda, otherwise known as the Good Witch of the East. The Broadway version of the story famously features the song "For Good."
The story, which is based off a book titled “Wicked: The Life and Times of the Wicked Witch of the West,” is also a Broadway play.
While promoting "Wicked," Grande and Erivo have gushed about their real life friendship on multiple occasions.

“I think both of us also knew that we wanted more than just this working relationship; we wanted to build friendship, outside of it, which is what we have now,” Erivo said in 2024 while speaking with TODAY's Willie Geist.
While speaking with the New York Times in 2024, Grande applauded her co-star and friend, saying their friendship was "one of my most cherished parts of this experience."
"I felt held and like I had a friend every step of the way. I’m really proud of us for how genuinely we took care of each other throughout this whole time," she said.
Erivo also appeared on TODAY during the 2024 Paris Olympics and told Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb that Grande is "one of the sweetest, kindest people I’ve ever met.”

“We’ve had such a wonderful time doing this together, and we’ve had such an experience learning about each other, learning about what we need and supporting one another," Erivo said. “She’s stuck with me.”

title: Jennifer Aniston Goes Instagram Official With Jim Curtis in Sweet Birthday Post
summary: Jennifer Aniston wished Jim Curtis a happy birthday in an Instagram post that appears to confirm their romance.
story: Jennifer Aniston appears to have confirmed a long-rumored romance.
On Nov. 2, the “Morning Show” star posted a black and white photo of her with hypnotherapist and coach Jim Curtis in honor of his birthday.
“Happy birthday my love,” she captioned the picture. “Cherished ❤️.”
The picture features Aniston standing behind Curtis with her arms wrapped around him, while his hands cover hers. The couple is looking off to the side while smiling slightly.
Curtis himself played it coy while reacting to Aniston’s post.
“😘,” he wrote.
Aniston’s post was received warmly by other big names.
“Beautiful couple. Healing kind angels ❤️,” Amy Schumer wrote.
“FINE I BELIEVE IN LOVE,” Kaitlyn Bristowe commented.
“THIS!!!!!!! ❤️❤️❤️” Amanda Kloots wrote.
Olivia Munn, Leslie Mann, Kyle Richards, Marion Cotillard, Miranda Kerr and Jenna Dewan also each reacted by posting heart emojis.

Aniston and Curtis have been linked for a few months, including after Curtis was spotted supporting Aniston that the Morning Show Season 4 premiere. But nothing had previously been confirmed about the status of their relationship.
Aniston has been married twice before: Once to Brad Pitt, and once Justin Theroux. Curtis, however, does not appear to work in Hollywood.

“Through his signature, Hypno-Coaching approach, Jim guides you to uncover and release the subconscious blocks holding you back, rewire your inner programming, and awaken the truth of who you really are,” his website says.
“This isn’t just about positive thinking — it’s about deep, embodied transformation rooted in neuroscience, intuitive insight, and soul alignment.”
Aniston’s personal life has been under a microscope since she soared to stardom on “Friends” in the ‘90s.

In addition to her love life being a focal point, Aniston, 56, has been the subject of pregnancy rumors over the years and has addressed the pressure she felt to have a baby. She has shared she had experienced several unsuccessful IVF treatments and told Harper’s Bazaar last month that’s a part of her life no one needs to know.
“That’s not anybody’s business,” she said. “But there comes a point when you can’t not hear it — the narrative about how I won’t have a baby, won’t have a family, because I’m selfish, a workaholic."
She continued: "It does affect me — I’m just a human being. We’re all human beings. That’s why I thought, ‘What the hell?’”

title: Judd Apatow Credits This Unexpected Legendary Director with Getting 'Anchorman' Off the Ground
summary: On "Sunday Sitdown," Judd Apatow recalled his early days as a comedian and explained how "Anchorman" got made when it was being turned down by a popular studio.
story: Judd Apatow says that if it wasn't for one iconic director, then "Anchorman" probably wouldn't be what it is today.

The legendary comedian explained how it happened on the Nov. 2 episode of “Sunday Sitdown." He said the first draft of "Anchorman," written by Will Ferrell and Adam McKay, told an entirely different story.
He said the plot was about a group of anchorpeople who survive a plane crash on their way to an anchor convention.

"So they crash into a mountain, and it becomes about them trying to survive, and slowly they wonder if they need to eat each other," he laughed. "And they brought me in at some point and they wrote a new script, which was what became 'Anchorman.'"
Once they started pitching the new script, Apatow said some people had their doubts about whether Ferrell could play the lead.
It wasn't until Steven Spielberg stepped in that Ferrell was able to secure his role as legendary anchor Ron Burgundy.
At the time, Ferrell was getting a lot of attention for his role as Frank in "Old School." Apatow recalled the comedic frat movie and said it was "hysterical."
"But DreamWorks had just put us in turnaround, which means they weren’t going to make it," he said of "Anchorman."

"And then one day in a meeting, Steven Spielberg said, 'Old School’s a big hit. What else do we have with Will Ferrell? We should do something else with him.' And they were like, 'Well, we just put it in turnaround.' And he’s like, 'Well, get it back,'" Apatow said.
Thanks to that decision, "Anchorman" was put in production, and in 2004, it hit theaters.
“(Spielberg) was the reason Adam and Will were allowed to make 'Anchorman,’” Apatow said.
Along with Ferrell, the movie featured then-rising comedians like Paul Rudd, David Koechner, Christina Applegate and Steve Carell.
Apatow said Carell specifically always had the movie's staff in tears.
"If you were on the set of 'Anchorman,' and you were just watching the shoot, there was no one there who wasn’t like, 'Steve Carell is the funniest guy ever,'" he said.

"So just one day I’m like, 'Do you have any ideas for yourself as a lead?' And then one day he told me about a sketch he worked on once about a guy who is at a poker game, and they were all talking dirty about sex, and it’s clear he’s lying and hasn’t had sex. And I thought, 'Sadly, I understand that,'" Apatow laughed. "I know how to develop that."
That movie turned into Carell's breakout film "The 40-Year-Old Virgin."
When asked what advice he would give to people who are trying to get into comedy, Apatow turns to his new book, "Comedy Nerd: A Lifelong Obsession in Stories and Pictures."

"Part of how I built the book is that I put all the failures in there also. So all the pilots that weren’t picked up, everything that was a bomb. And I talk about how that happened. How did things fall apart? What’s it like when they work? What’s it like when they don’t work?" he said.
"So you have to really be strong, and find your voice, and not give up," he added. "I always say, if you give up, it’s not going to work. So, the key is not quitting."

title: Does Justin Trudeau's Halloween Costume with His Son Reference Katy Perry?
summary: Justin Trudeau’s homemade Halloween costume appears to reference one of Katy Perry’s past viral moments
story: Justin Trudeau’s homemade Halloween costume appears to reference one of Katy Perry’s past viral moments.
Trudeau, who was recently photographed holding hands with the singer in Paris, posted a photo on Instagram posing with his youngest child, Hadrien, in their group Halloween costume.

In the photo, the former Canadian prime minister wore an inflatable shark costume and held a bloody surfboard with a bite mark out of the side, while his son wore a sleeveless wetsuit with fake blood dripping down the side of his face.
In the caption, Trudeau shared background about their costumes, which seemingly included a subtle nod to Perry.
“Ready for Halloween with Hadrien: he’s the surfer, I’m the shark (to his left),” he wrote. “We built the costume together — a little father-son Halloween teamwork.”
The caption seemed to reference “Left Shark,”  a viral meme from Perry’s Super Bowl halftime performance in February 2015.
During the performance, two dancers dressed up in shark costumes. While one dancer followed the routine to a T, the other — the shark to the left of Perry— was a bit looser with their moves.

Whether Trudeau’s costume was a true nod to Perry remains unclear, but the former politician, who served as prime minister of Canada from 2015 to January 2025, and the “Firework” singer have been spotted together several times since the summer.
Following Perry’s split from fiancé Orlando Bloom in July after nearly 10 years together, Trudeau was spotted at one of her concerts over the summer in Montreal singing in the crowd.
Perry and Trudeau were also seen together at the beginning of August.
Neither has publicly commented on the relationship rumors.

Trudeau was previously married to his wife, Sophie Grégoire, for 18 years before announcing their separation in August 2023. In addition to their youngest son, Hadrien, they are also parents to son Xavier and daughter Ella-Grace.
Perry shares daughter Daisy with Bloom, whom they welcomed in August 2020, more than a year after the couple got engaged on Valentine’s Day in 2019.
Despite the couple’s separation as of July, the two plan to co-parent their daughter together.

Representatives for the former couple told TODAY.com in a statement at the time, “Due to the abundance of recent interest and conversation surrounding Orlando Bloom and Katy Perry’s relationship, representatives have confirmed that Orlando and Katy have been shifting their relationship over the past many months to focus on co-parenting.
“They will continue to be seen together as a family, as their shared priority is — and always will be — raising their daughter with love, stability and mutual respect,” the statement continued.

title: '1000-lb Sisters' Star Amy Slaton Marries Fiancé Brian Lovvorn on Halloween
summary: Amy Slaton and her fiancé, Brian Lovvorn, are married
story: Amy Slaton and her fiancé, Brian Lovvorn, are married!
The “1000-lb Sisters” star got married Friday, Oct. 31, less than a year after she got engaged, per People.
Slaton and Lovvorn's Halloween ceremony was fittingly held at the Talbott Tavern in Bardstown, Kentucky, a site that is believed to be haunted.
“My wedding is a dream finally coming true,” Slaton told the outlet. “I’m getting my happily ever after!”
Slaton and Lovvorn had a small, intimate wedding with an “old-timey” vibe, complete with the theme “Victorian meets light gray meets dusty blue and white.”

For the occasion, Slaton donned a sleeveless white gown paired with a simple veil pinned to the back of her updo. The gown’s bodice was adorned with delicate appliqués that featured a floral and vine motif.
Lovvorn also matched the theme, wearing a dark tailcoat paired with a pair of black pants, a white shirt and a black bowtie.

Slaton’s look was complete with a bold hair color, at the request of her husband. She told People that she dyed her hair a “special color” for her wedding and previously told the outlet, “Brian wants me to have pink hair for the wedding, and I want to have a Victorian style updo.”
The couple waited until the wedding processional to see each other on their special day and exchanged traditional vows during the ceremony.
Slaton said that “getting married means that I’m no longer lonely because I’ve discovered my soulmate, Brian, is my happy place!”
“Once you get to know him, you’ll find him to be the sweetest, most caring person you’ll ever have the pleasure of knowing,” she added.
Lovvorn and Slaton first met at a concert in the park. However, Slaton told People she knew that Lovvorn was “the one” when he met her children.
Slaton is a mom of two sons, whom she welcomed with ex-husband Michael Halterman: Gage, born in November 2020, and Glenn, born in July 2022.
Slaton recalled to People how Lovvorn put a Ring Pop on her finger while she was sleeping just two weeks into their relationship.
“I was shocked at first, and I said yes but only if the real proposal was in a haunted house on Halloween," she recalled.

They eventually got engaged near the end of 2024, though the special moment played out during a May 2025 episode of “1000-Lb Sisters.” After five months of dating, Lovvorn popped the question inside a haunted house in Kentucky, with Slaton’s sisters Tammy and Misty as witnesses.

The TLC star said that she was thrilled her engagement “will be over with soon.” She said the couple were planning a “small, quaint” wedding and that they both “always wanted to get married on Halloween.”
Slaton looked forward to being able to call Lovvorn her husband and to “get to spend the rest of my life with him.”
“Our engagement life may be short, but our marriage will last an eternity!” she added.

title: ‘Love Island’s’ Nic Reveals Special Someone He's Hoping to See at the NYC Marathon Finish Line
summary: Since leaving the "Love Island USA" villa, Nic Vansteenberghe's been on the move.
story: Since leaving the "Love Island USA" villa, Nic Vansteenberghe's been on the move.

There was the "baecation" with his fellow runner-up Olandria Carthen, then more recently, a Miami trip alongside Season 6's Rob Rausch and Kendall Washington. In between, he's been training for his next big move: running the New York City Marathon on Nov. 2.
"Ironically, this week has been the busiest week since leaving the villa," Nic tells TODAY.com. "I have a marathon to train for, so of course the week of is going to be the busiest."

Nic, who will be running the marathon with Team Strava, says he decided to run the race just a few months ago, "which I know is a bit later in the training process," he admits with a laugh. The registered nurse already has two marathons under his belt — one of which was part of an Ironman race.
"Hopefully it won't be too hard," he says of the NYC race.
Even if it is, Nic says he'll have plenty of support. Fans can track his race via the New York Road Runners app, and "hopefully meet me every mile of the way," he says.
"I think the potential fan involvement is what's going to get me to the finish line," he adds.
Plus, one of his best friends is headed to New York to cheer him on throughout the race. He's also planning on having another special someone there: Olandria.
"She's flying in the day of the marathon, so hopefully she'll catch me at the finish line," he says.

Nic and Olandria both rose to pop culture prominence as contestants on the seventh season of "Love Island USA," which premiered in June 2025. After sharing a kiss in the first episode, they each moved on into different couplings, until fate — or more accurately Casa Amor — intervened.

Both Nic and Olandria were dumped from the show during Casa, but a getaway car twist whisked them away to a date, where they were given the option to return to the villa if they coupled up. They chose to give a romance a try with the Soul Ties kiss heard 'round the world, much to the joy of their devoted legion of "Nicolandria" fans who say they saw their chemistry on Day 1.
Their coupling finally stuck in the final week of the show, and Nic and Olandria were voted Season 7's runners-up, just behind Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales.
Since leaving the villa, they've experienced a whirlwind of events, interviews, sponsorship opportunities and more.

"I feel like it's been a year in the last four months with the way that things are going," Nic says. "You get maybe like one breather a week, so taking those breathers a week is helpful, and that's I guess the way that I stay present."

Just over a week before the marathon, Nic was in Miami for a launch party hosted by Celsius. There, he met up with Rob and Kendall from the show's breakout Season 6. Because they have shared "lore," as Nic puts it, they didn't end up talking much about what happened during their time in "Love Island" villa.
"I asked Rob specifically how he's been navigating the life afterwards," Nic says. "I think asking people from the last cast is so beneficial, because they've literally gone through the same thing."
His biggest insight?

"The thing that I noticed was that Rob and Kendall just seem to be the same people they were online. And so I think the biggest takeaway is just being who you are, and if people can't accept that, then they're not your cup of tea," he says.
When it came to balancing marathon prep with all his opportunities, Nic says finding the time to run helped quiet all the "noise."

"They don't go hand in hand," he says of his busy schedule and training. "But after doing the events at night it's nice to wake up early in the morning and get the run done. It's definitely a way to clear the mind."
Nic finished his past two marathons in around five hours and 20 minutes, "so I think hopefully that'll be pretty easy to beat," he says.
"That's the goal ... under five hours would be great," he adds.
After the race and into November, he says he and Olandria will have a "lot more downtime."
"I think at this point we're looking for just a breath of a fresh air from all the hectic-ness," he says.

"I've said this before, like I want to go on our hot air balloon date, I want to do all these things — but at this point, I'm like, I just want to sit on a couch and do nothing with her," he adds. "That sounds elite."

title: Heidi Klum's 2025 Halloween Costume Has Fans Averting Their Eyes
summary: This year, Heidi Klum revealed her elaborate and monstrous Halloween costume at her annual party in NYC on Oct. 31.
story: Don't look directly at Heidi Klum's 2025 Halloween costume.
The 52-year-old supermodel’s love of Halloween is as legendary as her elaborate costumes, which she reveals each year at her star-studded Halloween bash in New York City.

This year, Klum again was unrecognizable as she transformed into Medusa, a figure from Greek myth who has snakes instead of hair. She's known for being so hideous that anyone who sees her turns to stone.
For the costume, Heidi had a prosthetic forked tongue and fake snakes moving on her head. Her face and body was covered with scales, and she wore bright green contact lenses.
"HAPPY HEIDIWEEN 🐍Don’t stare too long or you’ll turn to stone 🖤 #HeidiHalloween," she captioned the reveal on Instagram.
On the red carpet, husband Tom Kaulitz accompanied her as one of Medusa's victims: a stone figure.
Keeping with tradition, Klum was tight-lipped about her costume until the big reveal, though she told People this week that it won’t be pretty.

“I’m going to be very ugly because I always try to do something different,” she said. “I thought last year, I was very cute with my husband as E.T. And the year before that, we were the big peacock with performers.”

Klum’s joint peacock costume with her husband, musician Tom Kaulitz, required 15 additional people to navigate. She felt the need to create that more “complicated” costume, she told People, because her creepy worm costume in 2022 “felt so simple.”
Klum added that she strived this year to do “something new again.”

On Oct.31, Klum began dropping hints about her costume early in the day on Instagram, first sharing a close-up pic of her terrifying fangs. “Ok ….. here we go,” she captioned it, adding ghost and spider emoji.
Over the course of the day, she continued teasing fans by showing images of herself having pea-green makeup applied to her face.

By evening, Klum shared a video of a makeup artist applying a latex-like material to her face that resembled monstrous flesh. She followed that up with a close-up video of her mouth as more fake green flesh was applied to her face.
Klum also shared a video of her and Kaulitz on her Instagram story that showed the guitarist's normally dark mustache and beard flecked with white.
Last year, Klum arrived at her annual Halloween party dressed as E.T., the lovable alien from Steven Spielberg’s hit 1982 sci-fi flick “E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial.”

Her costume was inspired by the makeover E.T. gets from his young friend Gertie, played by Drew Barrymore, who was just 7 when “E.T.” was released. As in the movie, Klum’s E.T. sported a long blond wig, red lipstick and a black hat and scarf.
Kaulitz accompanied Klum to the party dressed as E.T. without the wig, lipstick and human clothes.
Klum shared a behind-the-scenes video this week on Instagram that showed her and Kaulitz working with costume designers last year to create their E.T. looks.
“I have sleepless nights over Halloween. You have no idea,” Klum says in a voiceover at the video’s onset. “I always hope that it works out.”
The video then shows Klum walking down a hall to meet Kaulitz and the costume designers. “This is Halloween, this is Halloween, this is Halloween!” she excitedly chants.

title: Julia Fox Defends Controversial Blood-Spattered Jackie Kennedy Halloween Costume
summary: After getting backlash for dressing up as a blood-soaked Jackie Kennedy, Julia Fox revealed why she chose the morbid look for Halloween 2025.
story: Julia Fox is defending her controversial 2025 Halloween costume.

For an Oct. 30 Halloween party in New York City, Fox dressed up as Jackie Kennedy in a blood-soaked pink ensemble, re-creating what the former first lady wore the day her husband, President John F. Kennedy, was assassinated.
The look elicited many strong reactions online, with some social media users calling it "disrespectful."
On Instagram, Fox revealed why she chose the look for Halloween.

"I’m dressed as Jackie Kennedy in the pink suit. Not as a costume, but as a statement," she said. "When her husband was assassinated, she refused to change out of her blood-stained clothes, saying, ‘I want them to see what they’ve done.’ The image of the delicate pink suit splattered with blood is one of the most haunting juxtapositions in modern history."

"Beauty and horror. Poise and devastation. Her decision not to change clothes, even after being encouraged to, was an act of extraordinary bravery," Fox continued. "It was performance, protest, and mourning all at once. A woman weaponizing image and grace to expose brutality. It’s about trauma, power, and how femininity itself is a form of resistance. Long live Jackie O ♥️."
Fox wore the outfit at the annual Cursed Amulet Halloween party in New York City.

Jack Schlossberg, Jackie Kennedy's grandson, reacted to Fox's costume on X on Oct. 31, writing, "Julia Fox glorifying political violence is disgusting, desperate and  dangerous.  I’m sure her late grandmother would agree."
On TikTok, some users called the look "distasteful."
"That CAN'T be ethical," one user commented.
"This feels so wrong," another wrote.
In the comments section of Fox's post, some praised her explanation, while others still referred to the look as "problematic."

According to The New York Times, Jackie Kennedy, who died in 1994, refused to change out of her blood-stained suit after her husband's assassination on Nov. 22, 1963. She kept the outfit on when Lyndon B. Johnson, Kennedy's vice president, was sworn in as head of state later that day.
The National Archives has kept the pink suit preserved in a climate-controlled vault outside of Washington, per The New York Times.

The suit won't be available for public viewing until the year 2103 as to not "dishonor the memory of Mrs. Kennedy or President Kennedy, or cause any grief or suffering to members of their family," according to a deed of the suit from when it was gifted to the National Archives.

title: NASA Responds to Kim Kardashian Saying the Moon Landing Wasn't Real
summary: Kim Kardashian says the moon landing wasn't real. Here's how NASA Responded.
story: Kim Kardashian has a controversial belief that has people keeping up.
In Season 7, Episode 2, of Hulu’s “The Kardashians,” Kim Kardashian reveals she doesn’t believe the Apollo 11 moon landing in 1969 really happened.
While on set filming her new Hulu series “All’s Fair,” Kardashian tries to convince her costar Sarah Paulson of her theory.
Kardashian tells Paulson, “I’m sending you like so far, a million articles, interviews with both Buzz Aldrin and the other one,” referring to another astronaut on the Apollo 11 mission.
Paulson replies, “Yes, do it,” as Kardashian continues to explain.

“This girl says, ‘What was the scariest moment?’ And he (Aldrin) goes, there was no scary moment because it didn’t happen. It could have been scary, but it wasn’t because it didn’t happen,” Kardashian says.
Kardashian continues, “So I think it didn’t happen.”
A producer from her reality show later asks her, “Wait, for the record. Do you think that we didn’t walk on the moon?”
Kardashian admits that she thinks it was fake. The producer follows up with, “And what do you have to say to people who are going to say you’re crazy for saying that?”
“They’re gonna say I’m crazy no matter what. But like, go to TikTok, see for yourself," Kardashian states.
The viral clip lead NASA Acting Administrator Sean Duffy to take to X with a response.

“Yes, Kim Kardashian, we’ve been to the Moon before… 6 times! And even better: NASA Artemis is going back under the leadership of POTUS. We won the last space race and we will win this one too,” Duffy wrote.
Kardashian wrote in a reply to the X post, “Wait…. what’s the tea on 3I Atlas?!?!!!!!!!?????

Duffy answers her question, “Great question! NASA’s observations show that this is the third interstellar comet to pass through our solar system. No aliens. No threat to life here on Earth. 3 = the third I = interstellar, meaning from beyond our solar system ATLAS = discovered by our Asteroid Terrestrial-Impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) team.”
In the end of the post, Duffy says, “We love your excitement about our Artemis mission to the Moon. You’re officially invited to launch at Kennedy Space Center!”

The target launch date for Artemis II is April 2026 from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida and according to NASA, “Four astronauts will venture around the Moon on Artemis II, the first crewed mission on NASA’s path to establishing a long-term presence at the Moon for science and exploration through Artemis. The 10-day flight will help confirm systems and hardware needed for early human lunar exploration missions.”

NASA also has announced that an Artemis III mission is planned to launch in 2027, where astronauts will land on the moon for the first time, since the Apollo Program, more than 50 years ago. The United States has had 6 lunar landing missions from 1962-1972.

NASA describes the mission on their website, “Over the course of about 30 days, the Artemis III astronauts will travel to lunar orbit, where two crew members will descend to the surface and spend approximately a week near the South Pole of the Moon conducting new science before returning to lunar orbit to join their crew for the journey back to Earth.”

When Amazon’s Jeff Bezos launched Blue Origin’s 11th human spaceflight with an all-female crew in April of this year, Kardashian was unable to attend, but her mother Kris Jenner and sister Khloé Kardashian were on site in West Texas.
The astronaut crew included Bezos' now wife Lauren Sánchez, Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyễn, Gayle King, Katy Perry and Kerianne Flynn.
Kardashian was hoping to attend alongside Kris Jenner and Khloé Kardashian to support their friend Sánchez.

Jenner explained her absence to Blue Origin, saying, “Kim keeps writing us, because she was supposed to be here with us and she’s studying for law school, and she had a big test that she had to take. Again, something I’m very proud of. But she keeps calling going, ‘I have such FOMO, tell me every minute of it.’ So, it’s very inspirational and we’re proud of the girls every one of them.”
We will have to wait and see if Kim Kardashian attends one or both Artemis launches.

title: 'DWTS' Alum Maksim Chmerkovskiy Apologizes to Jan Ravnik for Slamming His Casting
summary: Maksim Chmerkovskiy apologized to new "Dancing with the Stars" pro Jan Ravnik after criticizing his casting on a podcast.
story: Maksim Chmerkovskiy is clarifying his recent statements about new "Dancing with the Stars" pro Jan Ravnik.
On Oct. 24, Chmerkovskiy appeared on his wife Peta Murgatroyd’s “The Penthouse With Peta” podcast and said Ravnik had "no business" teaching a celebrity partner on the dancing competition.
“There’s zero foundation, technique, quality, understanding of the partnership. Bro, I’m getting emotional,” Chmerkovskiy said during the episode.

Ravnik, who was previously a dancer on Taylor Swift's "Eras Tour," was partnered with "The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives" star Jen Affleck. The duo were eliminated from the competition on the Oct. 28 episode.
After facing criticism for his comments about Ravnik's dancing skills, Chmerkovskiy posted a new video to his Instagram page and explained what motivated him to speak out in the first place.
“First and foremost, I want to apologize to Jan for the way my words had made you feel, for hurting your feelings,” Chmerkovskiy said.
The professional dancer, who was a "DWTS" pro for 17 seasons, then said he would "love to meet" Ravnik and and "bury the hatchet."
“And, dare I say, we probably might even be friends,” he said, adding that he hopes a 1:1 meeting would leave Ravnik "feeling completely different."
Chmerkovskiy went on to explain that he didn't mean to offend Ravnik when he made his initial comments.
"I'm not not a friend, regardless of what I say. Maybe it's paradoxical, but my personality. (If) I love you, (I) will tell you how it is, let alone if I don't know you," he said.
Chmerkovskiy then clarified that he doesn't let "feelings and emotion" cloud his "commentary on dance."

“It just comes with (a) completely different range of reasoning. And, you know, I'm that guy. And so I would like to explain myself, like I said. I would like this to be personal because this is crazy to me,” he said.

Chmerkovskiy's wife, brother Val Chmerkovskiy and sister-in-law Jenna Johnson have all appeared as professional dancers on "DWTS." During his video message, the 45-year-old said many people reached out to him after his comments about Ravnik to criticize him for only winning the show once.

“You can’t really hurt my feelings by saying, ‘Look at you, loser. You only won once.’ Blah, blah, blah. Yes, I know that more than anybody else. I’m also very well aware that every single member of my family has won 'Dancing with the Stars' more than I have. They are much better at 'Dancing with the Stars than me,'” he said.
Chmerkovskiy explained that he always had a hard time mastering one important element of the competition: public perception and what people think of him.
"Fundamentally, I don’t care, and I lead with that. And because I lead with that, I’m not fighting for anybody’s votes,” he said.  “And so in a platform where that’s important, I’m not the guy.”
Chmerkovskiy said he was motivated to apologize to Ravnik publicly after doing some soul searching, not because of the public's criticism.
“(When) I realize something about myself, I realize it. It’s not going to be because somebody says that to me, it’s because I finally understood that for myself,” he said.
At the end of his video, the professional dancer sent a message to social media users, saying, "Let’s not defend someone by attacking somebody else. That’s all I’m gonna say.”
After being eliminated from "DWTS" on Oct. 28, Ravnik addressed Chmerkovskiy's podcast comments during an interview with "Entertainment Tonight."

"I have no comment on that. Look, I got all the love on this show. All the praise from the judges also, like everyone gave me so much love," he said. "Whoever is saying, outside, the people who (are) trying to stay relevant and spreading the hate, this is not a way to do it. And I never will spread or take the hate."

title: ‘Days of Our Lives’ Star Suzanne Rogers Reveals Colorectal Cancer Diagnosis
summary: “Days of Our Lives” icon Suzanne Rogers has announced that she was diagnosed with Stage 2 colorectal cancer and recently underwent treatment.
story: “Days of Our Lives” icon Suzanne Rogers has announced that she was diagnosed with Stage 2 colorectal cancer and recently underwent treatment.

Rogers, who has portrayed Salem staple Maggie Horton for 52 years, opened up about her cancer diagnosis during an interview with TV Insider published Oct. 30, revealing that her health struggles are the reason for her absence from the show.

The 82-year-old actor told the entertainment outlet that she decided to make an appointment with her doctor after feeling that something “wasn’t quite right” despite getting routine colonoscopies. She had another and the surgeon suggested that she return for an MRI, PET scan and biopsy after seeing her results.
“And the minute he said that I knew that it was something more,” she recalled.
She learned after another procedure that she had Stage 2 colorectal cancer. Her doctor informed her, “‘You have cancer and you have to start treatment,’” she said.
Rogers added, “It was all a shock. I mean, I think I was in a shock for several days because I take pretty good care of myself. But he said, ‘It’s a good thing you caught it in time.’”
She underwent treatment this summer after “Days of Our Lives” finished filming in June.

“It was radiation every day and chemo every day for six weeks and it was tough,” Rogers said. “It was tough knowing you had to do it five days a week and then you had off Saturday and Sunday. I thoroughly enjoyed my weekends because I didn’t have to go to and see a doctor. I was so tired of seeing doctors.”

Although she initially didn’t disclose her diagnosis, she later turned to co-star Linsey Godfrey, who plays her on-screen daughter Sarah Horton, for support. She revealed Godfrey held her hand during one of her infusions, and that other co-stars, like Paul Telfer, Mary Beth Evans, Stephen Nichols, Greg Rikaart and AnnaLynne McCord, were there for her, too. Producers also told her to prioritize her health and that she could resume portraying Rogers when she improved.
Her treatment ended on July 31. “I’m feeling really good,” she told TV Insider. “I start back to work next week, so we’ll see how that goes.”

She continued, “Now, I’m feeling anxious like I do any time I get scripts because I want to do my very best and you don’t want to hold up anybody. So that’s the only anxiousness I feel. It’s not because of my illness, let’s put it that way.”

Rogers said that her recent health struggles have changed her perspective on life. “It’s so funny because I used to worry about some silly things,” she shared. “And when you go through this, it kind of takes you a while to say, ‘OK, well, this is what I have, and I will do my very best to fight it and to get through it.’ And that’s what I did. The prayers and the good wishes from my friends and my family helped me stay positive and stay on top of it and beat this.”
Her “Days of Our Lives” family posted a message on Instagram about Rogers’ diagnosis Oct 30 and told viewers they can expect to see Maggie on their televisions again soon.

The show wrote, “We are delighted that Suzanne has come through this challenge with her trademark grace and strength. Fans will be glad to know that ‘Maggie’ will remain a constant presence in Salem.”
The post said Rogers’ absence on the show in 2026 with me “minimal.” According to TV Insider, “Days of Our Lives” films 10 months in advance.

“Days of Our Lives” had previously commented on Rogers taking a hiatus from the show in July. The soap shared a statement with Soap Opera Digest at the time that addressed rumors Rogers was leaving, writing that the speculation, “could not be further from the truth, Maggie and Suzanne are integral to the show’s history, present storylines, and now, on the heels of our pick-up, the future! Neither are going anywhere.”

Rogers has played Maggie on the beloved soap opera since 1973, totaling 3205 episodes according to IMDb. NBCUniversal confirmed that “Days of Our Lives” has been renewed for seasons 62 and 63 on Peacock.

Colorectal cancer develops in either the colon or the rectum, and about 3.9 percent of men and women will be diagnosed with the disease at some point in their life, the National Cancer Institute reports. Since 2018, the American Cancer Society has been recommending that patients start screening for colorectal cancer starting at the age of 45.
NBC News medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar said on TODAY in May that colorectal cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death globally.

title: She's Written Songs for Bad Bunny and Selena Gomez. Now It's Elena Rose's Turn in the Spotlight: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Elena Rose opens up about the inspiration for her debut album, "Bendito Verano," which translates to "Holy Summer," as well as going on tour.
story: Elena Rose has stepped into a new chapter of her singer-songwriter career with the release of her debut album, “Bendito Verano" ("Holy Summer”).

“I’ve always had the dream to have, to write and to work on an album, almost to the point that it became a little bit of a nightmare because I had a lot of expectations,” the 30-year-old Venezuelan singer-songwriter tells TODAY.com. “I was pressuring myself a lot, and it wasn’t the moment for it, but I would keep (telling) myself, ‘It’s going to come and be awesome.’
“I just had no clue what it was going to be,” she adds, having now accomplished her dream with “Bendito Verano.”

An acclaimed Grammy and multi-Latin Grammy nominee, Elena Rose — whose given name is Andrea Elena Mangiamarchi — has penned hit songs for artists like Bad Bunny, even receiving a Grammy nod for her work on “Un Verano Sin Ti," which became the first Spanish-language album to be nominated for album of the year.

Then there's songwriting credits on Becky G's “Mamiii" featuring Karol G, Jennifer Lopez and Maluma's "Pa' Ti," “De Vuelta Pa’ La Vuelta” by Daddy Yankee and Marc Anthony, as well as hits with Selena Gomez, Rauw Alejandro and Christina Aguilera, among others.
When it came to her own album, Elena Rose was inspired by her love of summer, a "heavenly" playlist, an Italian getaway and most importantly, trusting her intuition.
The result was a deeply personal 12-track, genre-blending album that Elena Rose says made her “feel proud" — and “transcended music.”
The “first name that came to mind” for her creation was Holy Summer, which she translated to Spanish.

“Summer is my favorite time of the year,” she says. “When I think of summer, I think of a sunset, I think of the beach, I think of the breeze, I think of happiness. I think of dancing and just having a lot of moments where you’re like, ‘Wow, this place is beautiful. Wow. I love the people I’m with. Thank you, God, for my life. Thank you for the present.’”
Collaborations with Eladio Carrión, Beto Montenegro, Young Miko and Justin Quiles, as well as dreamy angelic music videos for each track, only enhanced her vision.
Below, Elena Rose breaks down “Bendito Verano,” the inspiration for her opening song “Mantra,” her upcoming tour and more.
This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.

I think after (my 2024 song) “Me Lo Merezco” (“I Deserve It”) was born, I was like, “This is where I’m feeling the best,” because it transcended the music and it became more about the message and what it was doing in people’s lives.

It was that feeling of, “Look at everything we’ve gone through and we made it. We’re here at the beach, let’s just have fun and dance.” Mixing that feeling of what summer means to me and then asking the question of, “If there were to be a summer in heaven, what playlist would they play?”
Which is why we have sax, we have trumpets because I would picture angels performing in heaven. (I wanted this album) to help us remember the things that really matter ... and it would be about love.

We have elements like Afro that make me feel freedom, that make me feel at peace, joy and be in the present. There’s a lot of roots feelings when I listen to a bass line, or when I listen to the drums that remind me that I come from amazing people that have done amazing things in order for me to be here.

But then I have my message, which is where I really come in and put like my little grain of salt. I speak about mental health and awareness and emotional responsibility and real and unconditional love.

We went to Italy to record all the visuals. Every song has a visual. The first time I went to Italy, it was right after I picked up my relationship with my father. We hadn’t spoken in like five years and my father is half Chilean, half Italian, but grew up in Venezuela.

My last name is Italian, and I had always wanted to go to Italy, and I’m grateful it happened right after we hugged it out. Visually, the woman that I saw in Italy was a woman hugging everything about where she comes from and who she is. (Someone) who never lost her essence, but really worked on the woman that she wants to be and who she wants to be for the world and her industry and her craft. I’m grateful to see that visually. I needed to see it. And in a place like Italy, in Lake Como, the first thing that I thought was, "If God wakes up in the morning and opens the window of his bedroom, this is the view."
And then we recorded everything in Italy, aesthetically with this woman that you see vulnerability and innocence, but then you also see her strength and her resilience.
The album opens up with a mantra that I wrote with my life coach that repeats, "I am, I am." It’s just one minute. I want people to start the days like that. It's how I start my days.
The interlude was my best friend. I asked him, “If you could describe the warrior of light, how would you describe her?”
And then it closes with a song that I wrote to my inner child. It begins with my mom and my grandmother singing. So it’s very, very intentional, just a big ball of love.

I think every song has something like “Luna de Miel” (with Rawayana), to me, is the wedding song of the album. “La de Dios” is the moment to connect with the purest part of your heart, your inner child, and also to connect with God. It’s a reminder in a world that right now is in a lot of chaos.
“Aleluya!” tells you, love without fear. “Alma” tells you, look at everything that you’ve gone through. You’ve always had everything and if you lose whatever you have, you’re losing nothing.

“Amén Bebé,” you have a partner and you build something together, a best friend, a boyfriend, a dog, celebrate life. There’s a little bit of everything. I’m just grateful that I have an album that I think you can listen from beginning to end, and it’s gonna be an experience.

I’m excited, happy. This is my first US tour. We’re going to be presenting the album. We’re preparing a very intimate show, which is how I like it. I’m hoping it’s gonna be way too long and people are gonna tell me, “You guys have to leave.” And we’re all gonna be like, “No!”

I’m excited to see my warriors of light. They’re everything to me. We feed each other and we exchange energy. We elevate each other, and I’m bringing now a work that I put all my heart and soul (into), and I can’t wait for you guys to listen to it.

title: Bindi Irwin Explains Why She Missed Brother Robert's Performance on 'Dancing With the Stars'
summary: Bindi Irwin explains why she was absent from the "Halloween Night" episode of Season 34 of "Dancing With the Stars."
story: Bindi Irwin was noticeably absent from the “Halloween Night” episode of “Dancing With the Stars.”
On Instagram, the wildlife conservationist explained why she wasn’t in the audience to watch her younger brother, Robert Irwin, perform.

“Chandler, Grace and I all got a bug and I’ve completely lost my voice now…so we will be cheering (quietly) from our living room for Robert and Witney on @dancingwiththestars,” she said while referencing her husband and 4-year-old daughter.
She noted that she’s proud of how hard her brother and his dance partner, Witney Carson, have worked this season.
“They have an incredible dance for Halloween week, beyond proud of their hard work and dedication,” she said shortly before the episode on Oct. 28.
At the end of the caption, Bindi Irwin urged her followers to vote for Robert Irwin.
Her mom, Terri Irwin, commented, “Sending get well vibes!”
Bindi Irwin shares her daughter with her husband, Chandler Powell. In the post, she included a cute snap of them all together.

Though Bindi Irwin wasn’t in the audience to support her brother, Robert Irwin still came out on top for Halloween Night. He received the second best score of the night after dancing a tango to “Sweet Dreams Are Made of This,” by The Hampton String Quartet.
At the end of the episode, “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Jen Affleck was eliminated from the competition.
“I cannot wait to talk about this in the future with my kids,” she said about leaving the show. “I did this for my kids. ... I can’t tell you how much it meant to me.”

Affleck tied for lowest score of the night with actor Elaine Hendrix, who was hospitalized after sustaining a rib injury during rehearsals. Due to the incident, she and her partner, Alan Bersten, were judged on their taped rehearsal.
Hendrix is now recovering and has been cleared by doctors to continue dancing in the competition.

title: A Fox News report prompted Trump to post about Nigeria, setting off White House scramble
summary: A Fox News report prompted President Trump to call out Nigeria over the killing of Christians and then threaten military action, multiple U.S. officials said.
story: WASHINGTON — A Fox News report prompted President Donald Trump to call out Nigeria over the killing of Christians and then threaten military action, setting off a scramble in the White House over the weekend, according to multiple U.S. officials.

It’s still unclear what — if anything — the administration will do to counter Islamic militants in Nigeria, but precision drone strikes are among the preliminary options being considered, two U.S. officials said.
A White House spokesperson declined Monday to offer any details on the plans under consideration.

“At President Trump’s direction, the administration is planning options for possible action to stop the killing of Christians in Nigeria," the spokeswoman, Anna Kelly, said in a statement. "Any announcements will come from the President directly."

Trump's first social media post on Nigeria came Friday night after he watched a Fox News report on violence in the West African nation, two administration officials said. The president asked his staff for more information about the situation and, shortly after, declared in a Truth Social post that he was designating Nigeria a "country of particular concern" over its failure to, in his words, stop the "mass slaughter" of Christians.
Trump then went further in a Saturday post, directing the Defense Department to prepare for possible military action.
